title: Have you ever lost an Intro Bots game?
body:
I'm still learning the game and getting comfortable with champions, items, strategy, etc. so I only play intro bots. Over 100 wins later, this happened.

I'm at a loss of words, someone please comfort me.

replies.body:
Ah, you just unlocked memories I have suppressed into the back of my brain.

Back when I started playing league I used to play with a friend and we were doing an intermediate bot game, and what we thought was going to be an easy and fun game turned out to be a fierce 40 minute battle between us and bots. Unfortunately, we lost the match and we were completely silent after, in disbelief that we lost to some bots. Pretty much afterwards we agreed that we would never talk about it again, and I then completely forgot about it until I saw this post.

When I was still very new to the game, I played an intermediate bot game, after a lot of intro games tho lol. The enemy WW (pre-rework) got extremely fed and kept on getting one shots on me and my teammates with his ult.
I feel like everybody got annihilated in their first intermediate bot game lol

Sadly new players donâ€™t really have the same experience. The last few times I played intermediate games, which was middle-late area of season 8, the AI were really stupid and I could easily snowball and win even when I go solo top. To me the AI in intermediate bot games seem way more stupid, but that might also be because I am used to competent players and not dumb AI lol.

Your team consisted of an AFK, two scripters, a mage support, and a tank support. The Morg was probably new as well. Once you gain more experience, you'll learn strategies to better deal with this situation, like selling your ward item for a Titanic Hydra, buying a PD or Rageblade instead of second Triforce, avoiding fights and just mindlessly destroying waves/turrets, that sort of thing.

https://media.giphy.com/media/Dvw2lJqlTuJmo/giphy.gif

I've lost 3, I played a lot at first, didn't really play any PvP until i was level 30. The 3 I lost, 2 were really early, no idea what I was building. I think back then i thought more attack speed was needed as it meant I attack more so would get it on everyone. I also remember buying a bami cinder on Heimer as if anyone got near me they'd take damage. The last lost was because it was me, 1 other guy and 3 bots running down mid on Intermediate Bots.

Also, the Trinity Force thing, items do stack but not unique passives, so while you will still get the benefits of the basic stats the item gives (HP, damage, CDR etc), the 2 unique passives it has, will only happen once. Cho'Gath can legit if he wanted build more than 1 Warmongs ( {{item:3083}}  ), as his ult scales from bonus HP and it's a great source of it but he won't benefit from the healing passive it has twice.
Don't get 2 trinity force. Maybe you could have won with a tiamat/hydra to push minions faster and solo take the towers. Probably some of your teammates were bots too, leveling accounts.

I'm an absolute noob when it comes to items and get overwhelmed by the sheer number of options and when to pick them and why. I did manage to get to the towers surrounding their Nexus but alas, the sheer number of minions and enemies around our base while my teammates sat AFK or tried 1v1'ing towers top lane with no ally minions didn't help.

I have no idea, I'm still learning items and the only one I really know by heart is Tri force. Do items not stack?

> Stay in intro bots and don't play ranked cause it'll get you no where.

Relax, I have no intentions of ever playing ranked at my level, I only know what ~30% of the champions even do and have no idea what items to pick and when. No way would I touch PvP with such little knowledge.

Once you gain more experience, you'll learn strategies to better deal with this situation, like selling your ward item for a Titanic Hydra, buying a PD or Rageblade instead of second Triforce, avoiding fights and just mindlessly destroying waves/turrets, that sort of thing.
> 
> https://media.giphy.com/media/Dvw2lJqlTuJmo/giphy.gif

Considering I had no idea what you just said in terms of items, I think I have quite some time to before I met those standards, lol. And yeah, the game was questionable, our Riven came bot lane with me and kept trying to fight inside their tower's range before quitting the game for good. Our Poppy (level 20 btw) did nothing but tower rush top lane by herself with no help from minions, then did the same thing mid lane. I kid you not, she did nothing but run at a tower, smack it, and die. Our Warwick- well, I had no idea what he was doing. Out of all of them, I think our Morganna was the most helpful, she followed me to their base and helped hit the tower a few times before unfortunately dying.

> [{quoted}](name=WhatZeDuck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ajdrRQnU,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-01-24T22:17:13.109+0000)

> I have no idea, I'm still learning items and the only one I really know by heart is Tri force. Do items not stack?

Items don't stack and you are better going to ARAM or rotational modes (urf is coming soon) and PVP (summoner's rift) than playing vs bots, because you had scripted bots on your team and this is a problem that RIOT doesn't want to fix - I think that the company makes a profit from them - they ban cheaters and toxic players, then the same player buys a new leveled account and has to unlock the champions he likes to play again probably with RP, because it takes years to unlock them from just playing the game.
Stay in intro bots and don't play ranked cause it'll get you no where.
Why do you have two Tri forces.
